WorkItem.Description:
Downloaded and placed msi in c:\temp. Opened a cmd window as admin, set directory to c:\temp, ran installer. Installers does its thing but halts unable to find c:\temp\readme.htm. The file is not there and you have to cancel the installation.
 
A workaround is to simply creating an empty readme.htm file in the same directory as the msi file.
 
Who reads readme's anyways!?! :)

Comments.Message: Just realized there's one in the zip, but I had moved the msi. Such a hard dependency on the htm file in the installer is not a good thing.

For posterity, what I did was:
On Windows 7 Professional and Windows Vista Ultimate (two different machines I've tried), installing Configuration Section Designer 1.6.1  fails with message:
"Source file not found C:\users\ACCOUNT\AppData\Local\Temp\Temp1_ConfigurationSectionDesigner.zip\Readme.htm. Verify that the file exists and that you can access it."
(where ACCOUNT is your username) 
What I have to do is go to that location, open the zip file and create a blank Readme.htm inside of it, then click the installer's [Try Again] button for it to complete.
